headline: Copper Fever Cools. The Case to Sell This Mining Stock.
summary: Copper prices have been on a stellar run, boosted by President Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs.  Shares of  Freeport-McMoRan  and  Southern Copper  fell early Tuesday after Morgan Stanley analyst Carlos De Alba cut his ratings for the stocks.  The miner’s stock down 0.6% in premarket trading at $45.34, while  and  futures were up 0.4% and flat, respectively.

The miner’s stock down 0.6% in premarket trading at $45.34, while  and  futures were up 0.4% and flat, respectively.

headline: Freeport-McMoRan Stock Has Been a Copper Winner. How to Know When to Sell.
summary: Copper has taken center stage after President Donald Trump proposed a steep 50% tariff on the metal.  On Tuesday, the sector felt additional pressure as both  Freeport-McMoRan  and Southern Copper were hit with analyst downgrades.  Freeport is clearly in the lead, up 15% year to date, almost double Southern’s 2025 performance.

headline: Stocks Mixed as T-Note Yields Rise
summary: The S&P 500 Index ($SPX ) (SPY ) is unchanged, the Dow Jones Industrials Index ($DOWI ) (DIA ) is down -0.55%, and the Nasdaq 100 Index ($IUXX ) (QQQ ) is up +0.51%. September E-mini S&P futures (ESU25 ) are up +0.02%, and September E-mini Nasdaq futures (NQU25 )...

headline: Morgan Stanley reshuffles copper mining stock ratings, highlights growth concerns
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley has revised its copper mining stock ratings, citing macroeconomic uncertainty, stretched valuations, and commodity-specific risks.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley reshuffles copper mining stock ratings, highlights growth concerns

headline: Trump Trade: U.S. slaps 30% tariff rate on EU, Mexico
